parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To mock, ridicule. From en and paizo; to jeer at, i.e. Deride.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and the base of duno; to cause to sink out of, i.e. to divest.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Latin origin; the 'purple' mussel, i.e. the red-blue color itself, and finally a garment dyed with it.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead out, sometimes to death, execution. From ek and ago; to lead forth.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
